title: Salesforce Names Bret Taylor Co-CEO; The appointment comes a day after he was named chairman of Twitter's board
text:
Salesforce made the appointment a day after Mr. Taylor was named Twitter Inc. chairman that came with the departure of the social-media's company's CEO, Jack Dorsey.

Salesforce on Tuesday also reported a 27% increase in third-quarter sales to $6.86 billion and net income of $468 million. But the company's revenue forecast for the current quarter of $7.24 billion to $7.23 billion and for the following quarter of up to $7.25 billion came short of Wall Street expectations.

Shares in the software company closed down nearly 4% at $284.96 and fell more than 6% in after-hours trading following the results.

Salesforce was a pioneer in offering cloud-based software that has seen accelerated adoption during the pandemic, as businesses embraced such tools to function better with remote staff. The company that made its name by providing cloud-based software has expanded its offering, including through a series of acquisitions.

The company earlier this year closed its $27.7 billion acquisition of Slack Technologies Inc., the company that runs a workplace collaboration application.

The deal came after Salesforce acquired Tableau Software Inc., a data analytics platform, for $15.7 billion in 2019.

The Slack acquisition intensifies Salesforce's push to provide a broader set of business software and adds to the company's rivalry with Microsoft Corp., which offers its own workplace collaboration tool, Teams, launched in 2016.

Slack filed an antitrust complaint with the European Union last year, alleging that Microsoft was using its dominance to push Teams.

Microsoft at the time said that because of the pandemic, "the market has embraced Teams in record numbers while Slack suffered from its absence of videoconferencing."
